TopicTitle: If VR support comes i have an idea

Articles.Content: If ksp 2 will have vr support and robotics parts,  how cool it would be to control your own robots with motion controllers and those parts following your movement. This could acually be tool for real life human controlled robotics.
This game would be so cool in VR

The view would be astounding especially given the neat graphics of this game and potential improvements, but official VR support might be in low priority since not everyone uses a VR helmet to play a space simulation game. KSP1 does not have official support for it, but there is indeed a mod for this. Maybe someone will make it for the second game, or is a similar mod already in the works?
Unity has really good support for VR. It's a relatively low-hanging fruit. Relatively...
I think they should add VR unoffical just for people whom want's it can try it. It could even be one thing which modders would be interested about, and ksp is all about mods.

Yes KSP had VR mod, unfortunately it seems project was abandoned.

VR was very easy to enable in KSP 1 version of unity, even i could enable offical VR mode of unity to KSP, but hud adjusting is very difficult to do with mods.

KSP 2 Version of unity to implement VR is more difficult, it isn't just couple of parameters in-game files you change, VR has to be enabled inside of editor itself.
